name: Blitz
description:
'''Blitz''' is a [[Brazilian rock]] band, formed in 1981 in [[Rio de Janeiro]]. The band was the first to achieve mainstream success and to have [[hit single]]s (''Você não soube me amar'', ''A dois passos do paraíso'', ''Ana Maria (biquíni de bolinha amarelinha tão pequenininho)'') kick–starting the 1980s movement that would later be called "BRock". Its "classic" formation included Evandro Mesquita ([[voice]]), [[Lobão (musician)|Lobão]] ([[Drum kit|drums]], later Roberto "Juba" Gurgel), Antônio Pedro Fortuna ([[Bass guitar|bass]], formerly with [[Os Mutantes]] and [[Lulu Santos]]), William Forghieri ([[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]]) and [[Fernanda Abreu]] and Márcia Bulcão ([[Backing vocalist|backing vocals]]). Their ''Aventuras II'' album was nominated for the [[18th Annual Latin Grammy Awards|2017 Latin Grammy Award]] for [[Latin Grammy Award for Best Portuguese Language Rock Album|Best Portuguese Language Rock or Alternative Album]].

Guitarist Rogério Meanda died on 25 August 2025.
